name: TheAtlantic
text: "To be anti-racist is to believe in the word 'now.' 'Patience' is a dirty word to those incarcerated by inequity," @DrIbram writes: https://t.co/YvDDR4Gz2k

name: TheAtlantic
text: Astronomers have captured an image of two giant planets around a sunlike star, and the view is eerily similar to our own spot in the cosmos, @marinakoren reports https://t.co/KkqdRM9XnY

name: TheAtlantic
text: The pandemic could push the U.S. population to its lowest growth rate in 100 years, writes @jpinsk: https://t.co/508fl4rIdl

name: TheAtlantic
text: On this episode of the podcast Social Distance, @AnnieLowrey joins @jameshamblin & @katlwells to talk about the coming fiscal cliff and what the economy will look like after we drive off of it. https://t.co/x8k9A3fP9a

name: TheAtlantic
text: The Atlantic Daily: The Pandemic Population Lull, by @mimbsy https://t.co/ani8TEPkXe

name: TheAtlantic
text: Maryland Governor Larry Hogan wants to be the face of a kinder, gentler Republican Party. Does the Republican Party want that? @mckaycoppins reports: https://t.co/OqWz5AsbT0

name: TheAtlantic
text:
The best teachers don't ignore the chaos of the world outside their classroom, writes @chrisemdin. Instead, they use their pedagogy as protest.
https://t.co/3ku4eaCqBj

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photos of the Week: A cheetah at rest in Kenya, a giant spoon on an English trail, an online mud festival in South Korea, the night sky above Syria, wildfires in Greece, a Chinese mission to Mars, and much morel—via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/RAoIynyjWN

name: TheAtlantic
text: New York's mail-in voting fiasco has left one in five New Yorkers with their votes tossed out. There's no time to fix the problems there or anywhere by November, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/rHZroIphW9

name: TheAtlantic
text: U.S. citizens are finally confronting the randomness that travel and immigration are built on. @prashantrao writes about the declining power of the American passport: https://t.co/HDJjaytzdR

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Congress is risking turning a stalled recovery into a double-dip recession," @AnnieLowrey writes: https://t.co/dPjkNeAsS9

name: TheAtlantic
text: "If Justice Gorsuch wants to move the law away from nebulous, flimsy reasoning toward more textualist, neutral principles, he must account for both text and precedent," @JoshMBlackman writes: https://t.co/iUMQtQkFnk

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: Great essay from @prashantrao on the suddenly declining power and privilege of an American passport: https://t.co/Uq47BOYsGw

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @olgakhazan: Really great (and depressing) piece from @sarahzhang on why the existence of a vaccine won't be the end of our problems https://t.co/M6yOboICg2

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @fhill_official: "The classroom can serve as an example of what the world should look like ... rather than a replication of what it is." @chrisemdin is so wise and thoughtful on what teaching can be https://t.co/eYOPVJItqr

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @julieebeck: These women have lived across the hall from each other for 20 years and during the pandemic they opened their doors, sat in their respective apartments, and chatted across the hall! We had a very sweet convo for The Friendship Files:

https://t.co/xSQntdiUT3

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @andersen: Not talking to anyone about the pandemic this weekend unless they've read:

1) @sarahzhang's vaccine reality check:

https://t.co/dnEmQmf4jk

2) @DKThomp on immunity:

https://t.co/N39nOIhBtT

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @YasmeenSerhan: "Through circumstance, you are born in a place, and the history and the policies of that place will, for the majority of humanity, forever determine whether, to where, and for how long you can leave." -- @prashantrao 

https://t.co/WtMZHjxMJ0

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @prashantrao: U.S. citizens are finally confronting the randomness that travel and immigration are built on. I've written something for @TheAtlantic about the declining power of the American passport: https://t.co/YUq3s6N8gP

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: This is legitimately terrifying. https://t.co/qaKUirVaKZ

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @AdrienneLaF: "The leading COVID-19 vaccine candidates rely on technology that’s never been used before in approved vaccines." https://t.co/9NtWpAMKNl

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @DKThomp: A dark week, but here are four pieces of good news on the COVID-front.

1) There's a growing consensus that COVID reinfection is unlikely. Immunity probably doesn't disappear after a few weeks, or months. For more on how COVID immunity works:

https://t.co/kD1Pjrs59C

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @TheAtlPhoto: Photos of the Week: Portland Moms, Beach Astronauts, Fire Whirl - 35 images from the past seven days, including re-opening concerts in Australia and Germany, a virtual mud festival, a whale rescue, and much more. https://t.co/VDTxVySXB2 https://t.co/k0pQt7k70V

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @YAppelbaum: If you think the current economic crunch is bad? Just wait to see what happens if Congress pushes workers off the cliff. Essential read from @AnnieLowrey https://t.co/E2DmuVtytB

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @russellberman: The vote-counting debacle of New York's relatively low-turnout primary could be a frightening harbinger of what's to come nationwide in November, @IsaacDovere reports: https://t.co/ujgCBhNhIR

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @NickBaumann: New York's mail-in voting fiasco is a prettttty bad sign for November, @IsaacDovere reports. https://t.co/UUXEI2aWHX

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @IsaacDovere: NEW from me - what New York‘s election failure means:

No state has the time or the money to make sure vote-counting will go smoothly in November. And just about every state is about to be hit with a massive surge of absentee ballots.

https://t.co/iLKHo7gWjK

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: "it’s a lifetime between now and November." Don't take anything for granted. https://t.co/xjSgFtVhDa

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @mckaycoppins: "Welcome to the world of performative authoritarianism, a form of politics that reached new heights of sophistication in Russia over the past decade and has now arrived in the United States," @anneapplebaum writes: https://t.co/zeIKfxEOv2

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @anneapplebaum: Any rank amateur could have predicted that unprepared troops with guns would increase tension and prolong the crisis. But although the administration’s behavior makes no sense as law enforcement, it makes perfect sense as a new kind of campaign tactic.
https://t.co/3Cn2wv0w5a
